body.name: Dale Audrey | Pink Himalayan Salt Water Mouth Rinse | 16 oz. Bottle | Cinnamon Flavored | Natural Mouthwash | Freshens Breath | Prevents Bleeding Gums & Gingivitis | Alcohol & Cruelty Free | Non-GMO
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 16 hrs 4 mins
features: SALT WATER MOUTH RINSE – Dale Audrey Pink Himalayan Salt Water Mouth Rinse is 100% natural and contains hand mined Pink Himalayan sea salt. Our salt water rinse will freshen your mouth and soothe your throat with a sweet cinnamon taste.

IMPROVES ORAL HEALTH – Our salt water rinse will quickly become a staple in your routine to improve your oral health. Dale Audrey Pink Himalayan Salt Water Mouth Rinse reduces bacteria, promotes healing, and provides pain relief!

ALCOHOL & CRUELTY FREE – Dale Audrey Salt Water Mouth Rinse is never tested on animals, contains no artificial colors or sweeteners, is non-GMO, and alcohol free! Our salt water mouth rinse is safe and will improve your oral health without the use of chemicals.

EASY TO USE – Our Pink Himalayan Salt Water Mouth Rinse is simple and easy to use! Just swish 1-2 teaspoons for 30 seconds, and you are on your way to better health in seconds (see bottle for more information).
16 OZ BOTTLE - Dale Audrey Pink Himalayan Salt Water Mouth Rinse comes in a plastic, BPA free 16 oz. bottle for easy use and storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: besides it having cinnamon it's great for people to use that need a little wake up power. recommends for people who work graveyard shifts

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An excellent `non-sweet` mouthwash
reviews.reviewText: This mouthwash is one of the very few non-sweet rinses I have found available on the market today. My understanding is that when you use a mouthwash or toothpaste containing sugars/sweeteners, the bacteria in your mouth break down these compounds and release acids as a byproduct. This process lowers the pH level of your saliva. The end product of this process under anaerobic conditions is lactic acid. This lactic acid creates extra acidity that can decrease the pH to the extent of dissolving the calcium phosphate in the tooth enamel, leading to the start of a cavity. The acids released include lactic acid, butyric acid, and aspartic acid. When the pH level of your saliva goes below 5.5, the enamel of your teeth begins to break down, which is the first step in the formation of a cavity. So, I am wondering as to why there are so few non-sweet mouthwashes or toothpastes on the market!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it! Will purchase again.
reviews.reviewText: I use this product daily and have purchased it on multiple occasions. I like that it is all natural and has a pleasant taste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dale Audrey Natural Saltwater Mouth Rinse | Himalayan Pink Salt Water Oral Rinse
reviews.reviewText: I've used Dale Audrey oil pulling rinses before, so decided to give this new mouthwash a try. The quality is top of the line, as are her other products. This mouthwash is cleansing, refreshing, & very kind to your mouth. If you have sensitive skin or need a more mild mouthwash, this should work very well. I thought the price was a little high, but everything in the USA seems to be overpriced these days, compared to a few yrs. ago. Still, I think you can count on Dale Audrey products as a more natural & soothing alternative for your body than the more commercial, chemical solutions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Odd flavor. Not sure that it really does much in the clean breath department
reviews.reviewText: Looks like there are mixed reviews on this product. I was willing to give this minimalist solution this product, but it does not do the job. It is a lot like swimming in the ocean, and accidently swallowing some sea water.If you are torn as to whether you should or should not give it a try, I need to point out that there is a free trial-size sample available for this product before you buy. Just head to your kitchen, draw about a third of a cup of water, put a pinch of salt in it, then add a shake of cinnamon, stir, then gargle. If you love it, then you can choose whether you want to continue drawing free samples, or go ahead a buy the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This stuff taste nasty! It doesn't leave you feeling refreshed, or clean, or anything of the sort. It makes you feel like you just got a mouth full of ocean water. In the worst way. I hate this stuff. But it did come in handy when my kids had strep throat. Not that simple salt water wouldn't have done the trick. Whatever.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy on the gums and whitens teeth
reviews.reviewText: Highly recommend this over traditional mouthwash. This doesn't irritate my gums but the taste takes a minute to get used to. I also think it keeps my teeth white.
